titleStmt.title: A peace-offring to God for the blessings we enioy vnder his Maiesties reigne with a thanksgiuing for the Princes safe returne on Sunday the 5. of October. 1623. In a sermon preached at Manitree in Essex, on Thursday the 9. of October, next after his Highnesse happy arriuall. By Samuel Ward of Ipswich.
titleStmt.author: Ward, Samuel, 1577-1640.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A14755 of text S119479 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 25054). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 52 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 37 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from: (Early English Books Online ; image set 20122)
Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1475-1640 ; 1045:6)

titleStmt.title: A peace-offring to God for the blessings we enioy vnder his Maiesties reigne with a thanksgiuing for the Princes safe returne on Sunday the 5. of October. 1623. In a sermon preached at Manitree in Essex, on Thursday the 9. of October, next after his Highnesse happy arriuall. By Samuel Ward of Ipswich.
titleStmt.author: Ward, Samuel, 1577-1640.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A[ugustine] Math[ewes] for Iohn Marriot, and Iohn Grismand, and are to be sold at their shops in St. Dunstons Churchyard, and in Pauls Alley at the signe of the Gunne,

notesStmt.note: Leaf a3 is the title page, with line 5 ending "vnder". A1 (cancelled) is an additional title page with line 5 ending "enjoy". Variant: A1 present.
The first two leaves and the last leaf are blank.
Sometimes issued as part 7 of STC 25031.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
